data.name: 0000 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Koizumi and I headed to the scene of the crime to meet up with Haruhi.

data.name: 0001 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …That was fine, but…

data.name: 0002 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: …Then, perhaps the computer society encountered that kind of phenomenon…

data.name: 0003 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: …You've heard of that kind of thing before, right? It shows up in a lot of legends, so…

data.name: 0004 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: As expected of Miss Suzumiya. Quite the expert, indeed.

data.name: 0005 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: It's been getting awfully lively over here.

data.name: 0006 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: …What are you two talking about?

data.name: 0007 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: We were having a chat about the other phenomena the computer society members saw.

data.name: 0008 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Not about Class 1-10?

data.name: 0009 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Not this time. They also told us about various other mysteries.

data.name: 0010 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Perhaps they are hiding more tales…? Such is what Miss Suzumiya was wondering.

data.name: 0011 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It's easier to deal with things if you know what to expect before you witness them, right?

data.name: 0012 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Well, that's probably true.

data.name: 0013 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I sincerely hope it's nothing that'll get Haruhi too excited.

data.name: 0014 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: So, Koizumi. What other unnatural phenomena do you want to occur?

data.name: 0015 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The plain old seven wonders are boring, after all.

data.name: 0016 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Quite so. Passengers disappearing suddenly, leaving just an empty vehicle, perhaps?

data.name: 0017 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …Koizumi, could you stop that? Haruhi will surely get overexcited.

data.name: 0018 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Oh, that's the story about the American ship, right!?

data.name: 0019 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: If I remember right, the food was left there, still warm and everything.

data.name: 0020 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Indeed. It's a deeply interesting matter, however, the truth is as such…

data.name: 0021 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: The favored theory is of a sudden incident, causing everyone to abandon ship in a hurry.

data.name: 0022 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: When it was discovered, everyone's belongings were left as is, but…

data.name: 0023 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: It seems the idea of the food still being warm was a mere dramatization.

data.name: 0024 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Hmmm? Really…

data.name: 0025 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I'd definitely like to be on one of those ships.

data.name: 0026 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Summer means the sea after all, and that means cruising on a luxury ghost liner!

data.name: 0027 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Hey, Haruhi, what on earth is wrong with your thought process?

data.name: 0028 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Actually, a monster probably came from the sea and swept all the humans away.

data.name: 0029 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: That just occurred to me.

data.name: 0030 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Indeed, all around the world there are stor- ies of monsters appearing from here and there.

data.name: 0031 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: How about the Himalayan Yeti, for a famous example?

data.name: 0032 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: The gold standard cryptid!

data.name: 0033 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It's said to be an unknown giant humanoid ape right?!

data.name: 0034 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: However, according to later research, "yeti" is the local word for a brown bear.

data.name: 0035 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: And it seems what we called its fur was, in actuality, the fur from a brown bear.

data.name: 0036 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: So I suppose the explorers mistook it in the intensity of snowstorms then.

data.name: 0037 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Makes me want to tell them to look properly before announcing something like that.

data.name: 0038 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: It's exactly as you say.

data.name: 0039 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: On a similar note, there's Bigfoot in North America, but…

data.name: 0040 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Also known as the Sasquatch, right? It seems more like an ape than the yeti.

data.name: 0041 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: That's right. It certainly seems like a giant ape-man, yet once again…

data.name: 0042 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: The theory is that they too, are misidentified grey bears that inhabit the area.

data.name: 0043 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Ehh, that's a shame. I wonder why they mistook them.

data.name: 0044 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Legends and cryptids and such; Koizumi drip-fed Haruhi unnatural phenomena stories.

data.name: 0045 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Hold on... For a while now, Koizumi has just been bringing up this stuff only to deny it.

data.name: 0046 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: …Well, whenever they open the lid and reveal the truth, it's always something else.

data.name: 0047 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Hmm. Whatever the story, the twist is always the same.

data.name: 0048 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: …So that's what you're doing, Koizumi.

data.name: 0049 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: While the story suits Haruhi, it doesn't stimulate her curiosity more than necessary.

data.name: 0050 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: By doing so, you're nailing the ideas in her head…

data.name: 0051 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Right. Just to be safe, I'll strike a nail of my own.

data.name: 0052 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: To put it simply, those kind of phenomena come from mistakes or delusions.

data.name: 0053 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Indeed. It's precisely as you say.

data.name: 0054 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: As the old Japanese saying goes, "#P05the true form of a ghost is withered silver grass#P00."

data.name: 0055 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: If you examined the bigger picture, you'd likely find out that result is surprisingly common.

data.name: 0056 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: That's right. It's exactly as Koizumi says.

data.name: 0057 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: So, don't look at silver grass in the dark and mistake it for a ghost.

data.name: 0058 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I'm not that careless, you know. My eyes are good.

data.name: 0059 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: You don't get it. I'm trying to tell you not to jump at every little thing.

data.name: 0060 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: If the stories all sound dreamy, it's because they're products of your imagination, right?

data.name: 0061 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Indeed. And a lot of it was produced by our ancestor's #P05power of imagination.#P00

data.name: 0062 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: It's amazing what the power of imagination can do, huh?

data.name: 0063 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Even if something's actually not a big deal, it can make it feel like something incredible.

data.name: 0064 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: If you say all that, then what about you Kyon?

data.name: 0065 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Huh? What about me?

data.name: 0066 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Don't you know any interesting legends that would make me tremble in excitement?

data.name: 0067 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Uh… Don't ask me.

data.name: 0068 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: The two of you have strange stories so worldwide and fanatical that I can't keep up.

data.name: 0069 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: How rude of me. Maybe I should've gone for more general conversation.

data.name: 0070 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Don't apologize with that wry smile. Damn it, that churns my stomach even more.

data.name: 0071 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: If there aren't any, you don't need to forcibly wring them out.

data.name: 0072 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: There's a huge gap between our vice brigade leader Koizumi, and a low-ranker like Kyon.

data.name: 0073 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: It's like an insurmountable wall.

data.name: 0074 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Ah, really now?

data.name: 0075 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I have no interest in happy mystery chat with these two in the first place…

data.name: 0076 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: But I can't help feeling unsatisfied when you say that.

data.name: 0077 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Well, he sure knows what he's talking about. Koizumi is #P05an excellent vice brigade leader#P00.

data.name: 0078 (374.ja) KOIZUMI (古泉)
data.value: Hahaha, I'm quite flattered.

data.name: 0079 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: I could taste the slight flavor of sarcasm loaded in his words.

data.name: 0080 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Drop that refreshing smile that doesn't look flattered at all. It's creepy.

data.name: 0081 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: I suppose even I can tell a few mystery stories.

data.name: 0082 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Well if you can, get on and tell them!

data.name: 0083 (374.ja) KYON (キョン)
data.value: Ugh, w-well…

data.name: 0084 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Aaah, my mind went blank since you asked so suddenly.

data.name: 0085 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: Would you look at that. It's not good enough if you can't say them immediately!

data.name: 0086 (374.ja) HARUHI (ハルヒ)
data.value: I don't want to hear anything from you until you've licked the dirt from Koizumi's nails!

data.name: 0087 (374.ja) MONOLOGUE (モノロ)
data.value: Ugh, what a horrible #P05oppressive brigade leader#P01 way of talking.

data.name: 0088 (374.ja) INFO (CHOICE)
data.value: It's a mistake or delusion.

data.name: 0089 (374.ja) INFO (CHOICE)
data.value: Isn't that a dream come true?

data.name: 0090 (374.ja) INFO (CHOICE)
data.value: Agree.

data.name: 0091 (374.ja) INFO (CHOICE)
data.value: Refute.
